Very Low Auto Fares in Pune â€“ Not Matching Meter Rates I am an auto-rickshaw driver using Ola Auto in Pune, and I want to highlight a serious issue regarding the fare structure. The auto fares shown in the Ola app are much lower than the actual government-approved meter rates in Pune. Because of this, drivers face daily arguments with passengers and it has become very difficult to operate an auto-rickshaw sustainably.

Ola Electric customer support is useless. I have been calling continuously from 19 December, but there is no response at all. Complaints are raised but always stuck at â€œIn Progressâ€ with no action. They sell vehicles aggressively, but after delivery, customers are completely ignored. This is not acceptable for a company like Ola. Very frustrating experience.

Rapido isn't charging a 16% commission, but rather 32% commission in the name of GST. It's taking 16% as Rapido commission and another 16% as GST, totaling 32%. I am registered to deliver in a suburban zone NY but around 70% of orders I receive there require delivery to Queens. The play of acceptance rate based on the last 100 trips is It's simply ridiculous. You depend on a chain of 100 trips, a mix of accepted and rejected ones, each rated with four combinations that generate a result that, in my opinion, negatively impacts your acceptance rate 75% of the time. This is why you easily see your rate drop quickly and not rise at the same speed. This calculation method is designed to force you to accept every trip, regardless of how inefficient or poorly paid they are.

The app has a number of really great features, but where it falls down is the Support UI. Instead of speaking to person straight away, your stuck in a time consuming loop that ties you to a useless bot algorithm that keeps you from speaking to someone in Support. This adds serious delay to a delivery. If they had a Talk to someone NOW feature, I'd bump this up to 5 stars. But because Support is such a crucial part of the service, there are multiple flow on effects to customers & drivers.

It used to be great. since they changed how we get paid, it feels like I'm being robbed on most trips now. especially any trip over 15 miles away. In the past, a large percentage of my trips in my area were long-distance trips. Now, a trip to the airport in Raleigh that used to pay between $60 and $85 only pays $33. that trip takes at least 45 minutes to get there and then another 45 minutes to get back to the area I drive in. It's just not worth it to accept a trip like that.
